lead_paragraph: Through interviews with chefs and others, the documentary “Wa-shoku: Beyond Sushi” explores the growing popularity of Japanese cuisine in American cities.

headline.print_headline: Review: ‘Wa-shoku,’ a Documentary, Recounts How Japanese Dishes Took Hold in the U.S.
headline.main: Review: ‘Wa-shoku,’ a Documentary, Recounts How Japanese Dishes Took Hold in the U.S.

snippet: Through interviews with chefs and others, the documentary “Wa-shoku: Beyond Sushi” explores the growing popularity of Japanese cuisine in American cities.
abstract: Andy Webster reviews documentary film Wa-shoku: Beyond Sushi, directed by Junichi Suzuki.
